title: Partition assignment support in multi tenant setup
body:
Changing the generate partition assignment logic, to account for multi tenant setup. Introduced a StreamConsumptionConfig, which will provide the partition assignment strategy for the table. The strategies available right now are:
1. UniformStreamPartitionAssignment - uniform spraying partitions of the table across available instances. 
2. BalancedStreamPartitionAssignment - using AutoRebalanceStrategy to evenly distribute partitions of all tables on the tenant across the available instances.

title: Removing old jersey jars (1.9) that were pulled by hadoop-common tran…
body:
…sitively

Hadoop common and Hadoop client was pulling in jersey 1.9 versions, whereas rest of the code depended on 2.3 version. Controller console application would fail to handle requests with an error message - Grizzly request failed. 

Added explicit exclusions in the pom to avoid this error.

title: [TE] datasource - timeseries window aggregation with offset
body:
The existing, legacy pinot data source is unable to partially aggregate time series into windows/buckets that are not aligned with UTC time. Additionally, there is a (rare) condition where data set timezone becomes mingled with the timezone of the request range. This PR addresses the issue in the open-source pinot connector until the data source is re-written from scratch to operate on time stamps instead of bucket indices.

Additionally, this PR enables the frontend to request time series aligned to arbitrary timezone offsets.

title: Re-factor PinotLLCRealtimeSegmentManager methods to reduce the number of arguments.
body:
The argument count seems to increase each time we want something new. Passing around
tableConfig and kafkaStreamMetadata seems to obviate the need for most other arguments.
In another step, maybe we can also get rid of KafkaStreamMetadata, since that should also
be (technically) got from tableconfig.

There is still a dependency with the kafka consumer, so we still need to be careful in tests
ensuring that we don't start to initiate a connect to Kafka. At some point, we should
pass in a mock kafka consumer, so that we can can get the offsets we want from the
consumer. We are only interested in offsets for these tests.

title: [TE] Onboarding tasks: initial trigger auto-tune with pattern only, anomaly severity score

Currently when onboarding metrics with different granularity are using auto-tune. Based on the launch of alert page tuning, we move tuning sensitivity to "tuning page". When onboarding, we only tune "pattern" only to avoid potential alert delay. If users specifies "mttd" during onboarding process, then auto-tuning is triggered via "mttd" constraints as well. 
Within this pr, we also expose anomaly severity score by passing the anomaly probability

title: Refactor code to avoid duplicate retry on downloading segment to local
body:
This PR removes the outer retry wrapper code. That's because:

1. `downloadSegmentToLocal` method has already used retry policy to fetch segment to local M times (M = 3 by default). If we keep the outer retry wrapper, which retries at most N times(N = 5 by default), the total retry times would be M*N.

2. if an exception is thrown when untarring(right after the method `downloadSegmentToLocal` is called), that means the tar file is broken or not found AFTER the retry. There's no need to do it again. Simply throw the exception would be good.

title: [TE] Onboarding jobs
body:
During onboarding, exceptions are hidden in system logs. Although users are able to fetch job status through api call, it is not a good user experience to expose exceptions to FE. This pr is to send out email notification upon exceptions, along with some bugs fixed. 
Note that, the wrapper function for onboarding is resumed for a short period of time, until the whole onboarding job migrates to the new design.

title: [TE] Self-Serve tuning flow 02: refactoring edit alerts + misc
body:
In this PR:
- Removing metric details from alert edit view (since its read-only anyway)
- Adding granularity to general alert settings in `manage/alert`
- Changing performance formula in `alerts/performance`
- Some CSS changes

title: [TE] rootcause poc - support special characters in urns
body: People are horrible, so we need support for special characters in urns (with filter tail). Depending on the dataset, filters may take values that are misinterpreted as URN tokens, e.g. "pageId=my:app:/route/subroute?q=text". This PR adds frontend and backend support for URI-encoding URN fragments so that urns can be tokenized safely.

title: Use dictionaryBasedOperator only if dictionary is immutable, hence guaranteeing that it is sorted
body: In case of realtime consuming segments, the dictionary is unsorted. This results in wrong results for functions which use DictionaryBasedOperator. Introducing an api in Dictionary interface, isSorted(), which will return true if the dictionary is Immutable, and false if it is Mutable

title: Added on-heap dictionary support for int/long/float/double data-types.
body:
For low cardinality columns, it might be more efficient to store the
dictionary directly on-heap, as long as the heap foot-print does not
increase. The advantages are two fold:

1. Provides constant time lookup, as opposed to binary-search.
2. Saves on redundant ser-de of same values from byte-array to
destination data-type over and over again.

Heap usage increases long with cardinality of the item, so it is not
advisable to use this feature where cardinality is medium/large, or can
grow, unless the heap usage is acceptable.

title: [TE] rootcause poc - hook up rca v2 backend
body: The backend now supports long-form URNs (e.g. with filters) for metric analysis for both input and output. This PR adapts the frontend to enable full long-form support in metric analysis and event analysis. Also fixes the most egregious sort order and length-related display issues.

title: Fixed the flaky test for StringPredicateEvaluator
body:
Because we join and split with double tab delimiter, the integration test
becomes flaky when the random string generator generates a tab in the beginning
or the end of the string or generates two tabs in a row.

title: [TE] Add graceful error handling for pinot data source
body:
Previously, the method that fetches filter values drops the entire results if it encounters any errors when fetching the filter values for any one of the dimensions of the dataset.

This fix allows the method to return partial results and hence the frontend could still show time series without being blocked.

title: Remove having clause from the query generator for integration test
body:
Because the current having clause implementation is not complete, the queries with
having clause make the integration tests flaky. Until we fix the issue, we are
removing having clause from the query generator.
